alert.note: Alert for Northern Virginia Blue Ridge; Rockingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 07 at 9:35PM EST until January 09 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON SUNDAY TO MIDNIGHT EST SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch above 1500 feet elevation. * WHERE...In Virginia, Rockingham County, and Northern Virginia Blue Ridge. In West Virginia, Pendleton County. * WHEN...From noon Sunday to midnight EST Sunday night. A wintry mix of snow, sleet, and freezing rain will overspread the area Sunday afternoon between noon and 3 PM. Temperatures above 1500 feet will be around 30 to 32 degrees. Temperatures in the valleys below 1500 feet will be in the mid to upper 30s, so any snow or sleet accumulation will be light and freezing rain is not expected. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
